data.title: Vertical Progress Bar wrong direction
data.body:
The ProgressBar in vertical mode scales from top to bottom. It would be a lot more useful in practice if it scaled from bottom to the top.
Also, when setting the range, it should also clamp the value to prevent the situation when the range is made smaller than its current value.

Suggestions:
Have the text be able to show 2 modes: Percent (the way it is now) and Ratio, which would show "[value] / [range]", this would be useful for example:
 - Inventory:  "25 / 50 kg"
 - HP: "250 / 600 HP", etc
Which also means that you would be able to set the unit to something other than just "%".

data.title: Fix enable_pch() macro so that it is compatible with Clion 2017.2
data.body:
The latest Clion version produces the following error message when loading Urho3D project.

```
Problems were encountered while collecting compiler information:
    Cannot get the original file name of the precompiled header: /home/weitjong/ClionProjects/urho3d/native-Build/Source/Urho3D/Precompiled.h
    please run PCH compilation with -MD (or -MMD) flag.
```

See https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/CPP-10317#comment=27-2337396 for more detail.

data.body:
https://github.com/urho3d/Urho3D/pull/2041

Also ConvertModels.bat does not work never https://github.com/urho3d/Urho3D/pull/2044

data.title: Add contributor.
Bat-files use current path instead sources/bin when launched through symlinks
data.body:
It is normal situation when bat files used after cd.

But is some problem with ConvertModels.bat (I did not change it). This file does not work never.
```
cd /d "%~dp0"
tool/OgreImporter ../SourceAssets/Jack.mesh.xml Data/Models/Jack.mdl -t
tool/OgreImporter ../SourceAssets/Level.mesh.xml Data/Models/NinjaSnowWar/Level.mdl -t
tool/OgreImporter ../SourceAssets/Mushroom.mesh.xml Data/Models/Mushroom.mdl -t
tool/OgreImporter ../SourceAssets/Ninja.mesh.xml Data/Models/NinjaSnowWar/Ninja.mdl -t
tool/OgreImporter ../SourceAssets/Potion.mesh.xml Data/Models/NinjaSnowWar/Potion.mdl -t
tool/OgreImporter ../SourceAssets/SnowBall.mesh.xml Data/Models/NinjaSnowWar/SnowBall.mdl -t
tool/OgreImporter ../SourceAssets/SnowCrate.mesh.xml Data/Models/NinjaSnowWar/SnowCrate.mdl -t
```

If %~dp0 is builded/bin then not exists path  ../SourceAssets/
if %~dp0 is sources/bin then not founded tool/OgreImporter that placed in builded/bin
It will be work only when builded/bin is added to enveronment variable

data.title: Text with word wrap not visible
data.body:
If you have a Text visual in the UI that has the "Word Wrap" attribute enabled, the text does not show up until you set its size/width (again) in code.
So, every time you change the Text value, you have to also set its size again, otherwise it is not visible.

data.title: Fix mklink test when current path is not sources dir (for example whe used cmake-gui)
data.body: Also works correct when path contains spaces

data.title: [Editor] Camera rotation broken
data.body:
In the current implementation of editor view, if we rotate the camera, it will focus to the selection, and rotate around the center of it. This can easily loose current point of interest and troublesome when we are editing large scale of scene. We need to navigate back to the previous point of interest after every rotation.

For most of cases, we just want to rotate the camera and not want to "Rotate Around Selection"(it's an option of Blender).

Thanks!

data.title: Fix uninitialized FontGlyph fields in FontFaceBitmap (closes #2035)
data.body:
Commit 0450bcd1 added two extra fields to FontGlyph, texWidth_ and texHeight_,
but these weren't being initialized for bitmap fonts.

Bitmap text would sometimes randomly look OK if the uninitialized fields
contained large numbers, and fail if the fields contained zeroes.

Oddly, the C++ and Lua versions of the same example both work fine. Maybe a bug in the AngelScript API bindings?

data.title: Several tilemap improvements
data.body:
This PR contains several tilemaps improvements and bugfixes:

- Added support for tilesets, based on collections of images
- Added support for tile collision object groups
- Fixed debug drawing of isometric rectangle and circle objects
- Fixed tilemap debug drawing when node is transformed

Actually, this does not seems completed, I wanted to ask your advice on how to make these right:
1. I wrote function TransformNode2D(Vector2), it is simple helper function, which transforms Vector2 from node's local space to global space. It is used in two classes, and now I just declare it in one class and define in another. Where I should put it? I'm not sure, it doesn't looks so generic to put it in Node class.
2. To load tile collision object group, I copy TileMapInfo2D structure into local var and set there custom width and height, based on current tile width and height. Besides it looks hackish, it will work wrong, if tile width is not multiple map's tile width. I see at least two ways how to fix this: a) Create another class, some kind of "abstract objectgroup info", which will delegate position conversion somewhere else, and b) just make width_ and height_ in TileMapInfo2D some floating-point type instead of int. What do you think?

data.title: Initial commit of WebP image support
data.body:
https://developers.google.com/speed/webp/

Urho3D Resource loading of WebP lossless and lossy formats (*.webp).
Enabled with cmake build option (-D URHO3D_WEBP=1).
Default checks with Valgrind.
SaveWEBP() placeholder, not yet implemented.

data.title: void CollisionShape::DrawDebugConvexShape() function
Terrain::HeightMapToWorld() function
Built-in time triggered event in C++
data.body: Is there any built-in time trigger events? It seems that there is only delayed calls in the script engine and SDL_timer (not direct Urho3D). I have also found a thread discussing it https://discourse.urho3d.io/t/delayed-execution-in-c/3176.

data.title: CMakeLists.txt Could not call define_resource_dirs() macro before define_source_files() macro
data.body:
When generating build trees as per [this documentation](https://urho3d.github.io/documentation/HEAD/_using_library.html), an error occurs:
```
CMake Error at CMake/Modules/UrhoCommon.cmake:774 (message):
  Could not call define_resource_dirs() macro before define_source_files()
  macro.
Call Stack (most recent call first):
  CMake/Modules/UrhoCommon.cmake:1005 (check_source_files)
  CMake/Modules/UrhoCommon.cmake:1585 (define_resource_dirs)
  CMakeLists.txt:26 (setup_main_executable)
```
This is using CMake 3.9.0 on Ubuntu 17.04 with the latest Urho3D from the master branch

data.title: Specular calculation is incorrect: it is not eye direction ralated
data.body:
![spec_issue](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15721569/28356763-c47f7e4c-6c9b-11e7-8ddb-8575bcf80ad7.jpg)

The model is using 'DiffNormal.xml' technique (I also tried the 'DiffNormalSpec.xml' by adding a specular map generated by some textures generation tool).

According to the GLSL or HLSL code, Urho's specular light contribution is calculated under Blinn-Phong model and the specular (highlight) will be changed if we move the camera. However, there is no specular changing if I rotate/translate the editor camera which is very strange.

I hope there is something I missed otherwise it is an serious issue we need to solve.

SaveWEBP() to be added.

data.title: Quaternion-Vector3 SSE multiply broken
data.body:
The SSE implementation of the function:
Vector3 operator *(const Vector3& rhs) const
seems to be broken. 
When I multiply the Quaternion with Vector::FORWARD, the resulting vector has the y component 0 (when it should be something else).
I've tried getting the Matrix of the Quaternion and multiply that with the vector and that produces the correct result.
I haven't tried the non-SSE implementation.

data.title: Reimport Mutant with correct forward direction
data.body: Src blend files: https://github.com/1vanK/UrhoDataSrc/tree/master/Mutant

data.title: Precompiled.h not used because _FORTIFY_SOURCE is defined (GCC 7)
data.body:
Seems something in Release configuration is triggering gcc buffer overflow protections, which disables PCH (Precompiled.h not found) and fails build. This is with gcc 7.1.1 linux.

```
Precompiling header file 'Precompiled.h' for Release configuration
Scanning dependencies of target Urho3D
...
Building CXX object Source/Urho3D/CMakeFiles/Urho3D.dir/Audio/Sound.cpp.o
cc1plus: warning: urho/build-r/Source/Urho3D/Precompiled.h.gch/Precompiled.h.gch.Release: not used because `_FORTIFY_SOURCE' is defined [-Winvalid-pch]
```

This can be disabled with -D_FORTIFY_SOURCE=0
http://dustin.schultz.io/turning-off-buffer-overflow-protections-in-gcc.html

Edit: fixed URL link

data.title: "Roughness", "Metallic" material parameters
data.body: Since Urho3D 1.6, the material created by the constructor has "Roughness" and "Metallic" parameters. This is a waste of resources when PBR is not used. This is also a bad architectural solution, the Material class should not know about the specific material types.
